quest.name: Going Underground
journal: Fourchenault's ability to maintain a stiff upper lip is being sorely tested.

Alphinaud's proposal to aid the Forum in improving their starship in exchange for being allowed to borrow it for some unspecified undertaking was, surprisingly, accepted by the majority. Fourchenault, who was on the losing side of the vote, now finds himself forced to comply with the wishes of the Forum and guide the Scions to the secret location where the ark is undergoing its final adjustments.

The descent into the lower reaches of Labyrinthos begins at the Archeion, though you are required to obtain permission to ride the lift before proceeding farther. Having seen to the arrangements, Fourchenault leads the way to the Medial Circuit.
You follow Fourchenault past the many and varied facilities of the Medial Circuit, before arriving at Logistikon Alpha.

Alphinaud regales you with a tale from his childhood in which his father taught him the fundamentals of precipitation. Though somewhat unrelated to your present endeavor, the anecdote serves to remind you that relations between Alphinaud and Fourchenault were not always as strained as they have been in recent years...

You ride the lift down to the Central Circuit, where the Forum's greatest secrets are apparently kept. Despite the many hurdles you were required to overcome to even set foot here, Fourchenault permits you free rein of the area. However, as time is of the essence, you decide that you had best save your wandering for another time.

Fourchenault explains that the aetherburner is being constructed in a nearby location under the supervision of one Kokkol Dankkol. He then leads the way down the path, followed closely by your fellow Scions.

After finally rousing Kokkol Dankkol from his pondering, the eccentric engineer explains that in order to render the ark capable of achieving the required speeds, he must obtain large quantities of refined adamantite. Though you are no stranger to seeking out rare materials, this particular alloy is believed to be found only in certain highly coveted Allagan artifacts, such as those hidden in the depths of Dalamud's shards. Given the inherent risk in venturing inside these sites, Kokkol has refrained from sending gleaners to procure the adamantite. Luckily for him and the Scions, you have an extensive network of able-bodied warriors ready and willing to undertake such expeditions. With an impromptu linkpearl conversation, Alphinaud arranges for quantities of the metal to be delivered from every corner of the world─along with a Far Eastern relic or two from Othard─which should resolve Kokkol's predicament.

With so many visitors expected to be pouring into Sharlayan in the near future, Krile decides to return to the surface to make the necessary arrangements. She also hints that she may have her own means of acquiring refined adamantite, but decides to keep her source a secret for the time being.
objectives: Speak with Fourchenault outside the Archeion.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: As Father seems so eager to help, maybe we can have him educate us about the aetherburner.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: While I very much take issue with the Forum's approach to selecting whom to save and when, they're not wrong for wanting to minimize potential conflicts.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Fortunately, if this plan of ours actually works, the great exodus itself will become entirely unnecessary...

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: My affinity for espionage may have earned me the title of Archon, but I was completely unaware of the Forum's plans. There may have been clues here and there, had I been of a mind to look for them...but contemplating that possibility only serves to further wound my pride.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Not that anyone could have realistically surmised that their brilliant stratagem was to build a giant ship, fly to the moon─a still-larger vessel in truth─and use that to travel to another star. Even now, the whole idea seems positively absurd when spoken aloud.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Of late, I have seen no sign of the Loporrits...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: This being their first opportunity to experience the wonders of Sharlayan, the potential for misadventure is nigh infinite...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I'm a little vexed that we've yet to learn of the Forum's replacement for the Antitower, though I expect that in time, they'll share that too with us─and with Master Matoya, if they've any sense.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: The further we pursue the mysteries of the universe, the more I struggle to comprehend the fortuitous nature of time itself.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: We measure and quantify it based on observations of celestial bodies, such as the sun and moon, but from your account it is unclear whether the ancients viewed time in a similar manner...

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: I mention this because while Venat knew the Final Days would reoccur at a defined point in the future, she presumably had no way of knowing exactly when.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Even so, the completion of the Forum's preparations to escape to the moon aligning so closely with the advent of the Final Days is surely no coincidence...

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Perhaps if Midgardsormr were still alive─in the traditional sense, that is─he could have offered to help the vessel attain the necessary speeds.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Then again, there's no guarantee his contribution would make enough of a difference to matter.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Phew... I'll admit, bringing up the issue of the Forum's incomplete ark was more than a little daunting.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: They were, to their credit, quite open about the current state of affairs. What was even more surprising, though, was when they took Alphinaud up on his offer!

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: As instructed, I shall take you to see the aetherburner.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: Meet me outside the Archeion. I trust you can make your own way there.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: So the ark is being built in Labyrinthos. Hardly surprising. Where else could they conceal such a massive undertaking...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Where once we were refused entry, we are now welcomed as guests...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: It seems so long ago we first set foot here.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Some would surely object to the Forum allowing “foreign elements” to have the run of their secret facilities. We should count ourselves lucky.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Among the many and varied documents sent to the moon, I did chance upon several inventories made in the Archeion.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Mayhap the Forum believed such records would provide insight into the intricacies of clerical duties. Regardless, the Loporrits did not consider them worthy of more than a cursory glance.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: That we have been granted permission to enter the lower levels is proof of our increased standing. Would that they had been willing to confide in us sooner...

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: It has been many moons since I last visited Labyrinthos. As vast as the archives were back then, they've only continued to grow in the days since.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: I don't understand the appeal of reshaping it to look like the world above. Make your peace with what it is, or go outside if that's what you prefer.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Do they intend to carry everything in the Archeion to the moon? They said they'd started loading scientific records and biological samples, but do they really need all of it?

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: Our destination lies in the lower levels.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: The Forum, in its wisdom, has granted you access to the Archeion's lift.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: Step inside and have Ophilyne take you to the Medial Circuit.

dialogue.name: OPHILYNE
dialogue.text: You wish to use the lift, yes?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Proceed to the Medial Circuit?

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: I have sent your associates ahead to Logistikon Alpha, on the other side of Meryall Agronomics.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: Actually...there is something I have been meaning to...

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: ...No, never mind. It can wait. Let us attend to the matter at hand.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We are to wait here while our father arranges for us to use the next lift.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: “Here” being Logistikon Alpha, where the atmospheric conditions of Labyrinthos are regulated.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Water is drawn from underground and dispersed as vapor, stimulating the formation of artificial clouds and rain.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: By manipulating the temperature and air circulation, they are able to create the ideal environment for the growth and preservation of the biological samples kept here.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Hold on. How do you know so much about it?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Why, Father brought me here as a child.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: What!? And left me behind!?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Actually, you're the one who left me behind, when you went off somewhere with Grandfather.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The night before, I'd been asking Father how clouds are made, so he decided to show me. It was fascinating─I peppered him with questions the entire time.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: 'Tis all too easy to take for granted the many interweaving aspects of the natural world. To grow inured to the wondrous.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: But having gained an understanding of the complex mechanisms employed by the Loporrits in recreating a similar environment, I have come to view such processes in a new light.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: The subterranean gardens of Labyrinthos, the lunar prison forged to contain the ancient Zodiark, the habitations built for all mankind 'neath the moon's surface... Each unique, yet undeniably similar.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: 'Tis no mere coincidence.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: Ever since Hydaelyn unfolded to us the grim fate that awaits Etheirys, every essential resource we could spare has been delivered to Labyrinthos, in preparation for the great exodus. But that is not all...

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: It is also a testing ground for the technologies that will allow us to settle on distant stars.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: Though the Loporrits have endeavored to make the moon inhabitable, that is not our final destination. Mankind must learn to propagate life where there is none, to thrive where all is barren.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: Alas, time is not on our side.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: I have arranged for you all to enter the Central Circuit. It is there that most of our preparations for the great exodus are carried out, the construction of the ark among them.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: Though our plans have been made public, access remains highly restricted. You, however, will not be subject to said restrictions, and will have free rein to come and go as you please. Such was the will of the Forum, after all.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We will prove ourselves worthy of their trust. Your trust.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: Then let us proceed.

dialogue.name: HESTER
dialogue.text: By decree of the Forum, the Scions of the Seventh Dawn are permitted to enter the Central Circuit.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Proceed to the Central Circuit?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: This is it... The Central Circuit!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Please tell me we're almost there... Or is there another underground level we have to reach? The Even-more-central Circuit, perhaps?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: The farther down we travel, the more expansive the sky above becomes, artificial though it is.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Would that the heavens elsewhere could be so idyllic...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: The temperate environment here is not unlike that of Bestways Burrow, though the diverse vegetation doth produce a far more complex bouquet of aromas. A welcome difference indeed, for I have grown weary of the scent of carrots...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I imagine the secrets kept here would be of great benefit to mine own research, but I will refrain from indulging my curiosity for the time being.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: The sooner we can get a look at this aetherburner of theirs, the sooner we can start working out how to improve it!

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: I have no idea what makes Alphinaud so confident we can solve this problem of theirs. Relentless optimism, I presume. A not-unwelcome trait in a youth...but less so in a gambler. Aye─let us resolve never to let him set foot in the Gold Saucer.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: We might finally have the chance to commune directly with Hydaelyn...provided we somehow manage to succeed where Sharlayan's finest engineers have failed. Still, it won't hurt to have a look!

dialogue.name: HESTER
dialogue.text: Do you wish to enter the Central Circuit?

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: The aetherburner is being constructed not far from here.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: Overseeing the work is Kokkol Dankkol, after whom the forge is named.

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: Once the necessary introductions have been made, I shall leave you with him to discuss the particulars. This way.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Perhaps you'd like to break the ice?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Is he...talking to himself?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: For a closely guarded secret, you can see practically everything from outside, even with the magical barrier surrounding it...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Surely the Forum hath already petitioned the aid of the Loporrits, given their familiarity with such technologies...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: While many of the facilities within the Central Circuit seem to be visible from the upper levels, the more secretive work must be carried out behind closed doors.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: He hasn't even realized we're here... Or perhaps he has realized, but just doesn't care.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: I was expecting the Skysteel Manufactory, but instead I find the village smithy...

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: He looks lost in thought, although it seems he's hit something of a stumbling block...

dialogue.name: FOURCHENAULT
dialogue.text: This is the man we seek. Do try not to startle him...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: There are no oaths or contracts binding the members of the Ilsabard contingent, and in many ways, it was even more loosely organized than the Crystal Braves.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Nevertheless, I knew none would refuse this call to arms. Truly, we have been blessed with trustworthy and dependable allies.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Though Bahamut is long gone, the internment hulks are far from safe.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: It could be much worse, of course. They won't have to fight their way past Meracydian dragons, nor is there any danger the elder primal might be summoned again.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Even so, I daresay there are still a fair few Allagan creations and contraptions remaining to bar our friends' way. I only hope that Grandfather watches over them.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Well, I'm all for relying on the power of friendship, but we're now left with the rare luxury of having nothing to do. There must be something that requires our attention!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: First the Telophoroi, and now the Final Days. Heh─no one can accuse the Ilsabard contingent of backing down from a challenge!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Of course, they weren't all so committed to the cause when we first set out.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: But after seeing the example set by you, Alphinaud, and the others, the change was palpable. They couldn't help but believe.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: What serendipitous irony that the remnants of the Seventh Umbral Calamity would become the keys to mankind's salvation. Never more certain have I been that Master Louisoix watcheth over us from the aetherial sea...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I'm confident that even the deadliest of Allagan defense mechanisms are no match for our allies.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: At this rate, some of them might soon have as many accomplishments to their names as a certain Warrior of Light.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Time and time again, it seems that Allagan something-or-other are either the cause of or the solution to our problems.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Hmm... To think the selfsame materials that once launched Dalamud will now be used to help ferry mankind to the moon. There's a poetry in that.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: ...Considering how much of a fuss he made at the time, I don't see why he takes every opportunity to bring it up. It was just firewood.

dialogue.name: KOKKOLDANKKOL
dialogue.text: 'Preciate you doin' all this, but I ain't gettin' me hopes up just yet!

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: It's times like these we're reminded of how famous─or infamous─Alphinaud has become. Who'd have thought he could achieve so much with a single linkpearl conversation!

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: As we're expecting rather a lot of visitors in the near future, I'd best return to the surface and inform the relevant parties.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: I also have a contact of my own that might be worth a try...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Oh? And who might that be?

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: That's for me to know and you to find out!

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: And on that note, I leave matters here in your capable hands. Best of luck!
